DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Radiology Endoscopic Procedure Disease or Disorder Evaluation Performed Most Recent Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the most recent date a systematic, objective appraisal of any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues using radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) or endoscopy, use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body, was performed to diagnose any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Radiology Endoscopic Procedure Disease or Disorder Evaluation Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the systematic, objective appraisal of any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues using radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) or endoscopy, use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body, to diagnose any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Radiology Endoscopy Disease or Disorder Evaluation Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The use of radiation (such as x-rays) or other imaging technologies (such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease.:(en-DAHS-ko-pee) The use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.
A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the most recent date of an event, assessment, or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Nearest to the present time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Date of most recent scan or endoscopic exam

DataElement.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
